An act to reaffirm the inherent sovereign rights of the Osage Tribe to determine its membership and form of government

extension.searchTitle: 118 Stat. 2609; United States Statutes at Large, Volume 118, 108th Congress, 2nd Session; An act to reaffirm the inherent sovereign rights of the Osage Tribe to determine its membership and form of government; An act for the division of lands and funds of the Osage Indians in Oklahoma Territory, and for other purposes'', approved June 28, 1906 (34 Stat. 539), means the persons eligible for allotments of Osage Reservation lands and a pro rata share of the Osage mineral estate as provided in that Act, not membership in the Osage Tribe for all purposes. Congress hereby reaffirms the inherent sovereign right of the Osage Tribe to determine its own membership, provided that the rights of any person to Osage mineral estate shares are not diminished thereby. (2) Government.--Notwithstanding section 9 of the Act entitled, ``An Act For the division of lands and funds of the Osage Indians in Oklahoma Territory, and for other purposes'', approved June 28, 1906 (34 Stat. 539), Congress hereby reaffirms the inherent sovereign right of the Osage Tribe to determine its own form of government.; Public Law 108-431

category.level3: Osage tribe, sovereign rights reaffirmation
Osage tribe, sovereign rights reaffirmation

extension.titles: An act for the division of lands and funds of the Osage Indians in Oklahoma Territory, and for other purposes'', approved June 28, 1906 (34 Stat. 539), means the persons eligible for allotments of Osage Reservation lands and a pro rata share of the Osage mineral estate as provided in that Act, not membership in the Osage Tribe for all purposes. Congress hereby reaffirms the inherent sovereign right of the Osage Tribe to determine its own membership, provided that the rights of any person to Osage mineral estate shares are not diminished thereby. (2) Government.--Notwithstanding section 9 of the Act entitled, ``An Act For the division of lands and funds of the Osage Indians in Oklahoma Territory, and for other purposes'', approved June 28, 1906 (34 Stat. 539), Congress hereby reaffirms the inherent sovereign right of the Osage Tribe to determine its own form of government.

Congress hereby reaffirms the inherent sovereign right of the Osage Tribe to determine its own membership, provided that the rights of any person to Osage mineral estate shares are not diminished thereby. (2) Government.--Notwithstanding section 9 of the Act entitled, ``An Act For the division of lands and funds of the Osage Indians in Oklahoma Territory, and for other purposes'', approved June 28, 1906 (34 Stat. 539), Congress hereby reaffirms the inherent sovereign right of the Osage Tribe to determine its own form of government.

extension.titles: An act to amend title 38, United States Code, to simplify and improve pay provisions for physicians and dentists and to authorize alternate work schedules and executive pay for nurses, and for other purposes.
extension.shortTitle: Department of Veterans Affairs Health Care Personnel Enhancement Act of 2004
Department of Veterans Affairs Health Care Personnel Enhancement Act of 2004
extension.legislativeHistory: LEGISLATIVE HISTORY--S. 2965:<br/><br/>CONGRESSIONAL RECORD, Vol. 150 (2004):<br/> Oct. 8, considered and passed Senate.<br/> Nov. 17, considered and passed House.<br/><br/>[[Page 2636]]<br/>118 STAT. 2636<br/><br/>108th Congress<br/><br/> An Act<br/><br/><br/><br/> To amend title 38, United States Code, to simplify and improve pay<br/> provisions for physicians and dentists and to authorize alternate work<br/> schedules and executive pay for nurses, and for other<br/> purposes.<br/><br/> Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the<br/>United States of America in Congress assembled, NOTE: Department of<br/>Veterans Affairs Health Care Personnel Enhancement Act of 2004.<br/><br/>SECTION 1. SHORT TITLE. NOTE: 38 USC 101 note.<br/><br/> This Act may be cited as the ``Department of Veterans Affairs Health<br/>Care Personnel Enhancement Act of 2004''.<br/><br/>SEC. 2. REFERENCES TO TITLE 38, UNITED STATES CODE.<br/><br/> Except as otherwise expressly provided, whenever in this Act an<br/>amendment is expressed in terms of an amendment to a section or other<br/>provision, the reference shall be considered to be made to a section or<br/>other provision of title 38, United States Code.<br/>SEC. 3. SIMPLIFICATION AND IMPROVEMENT OF GRADE AND PAY PROVISIONS<br/> FOR PHYSICIANS AND DENTISTS.<br/><br/> (a) Simplification of Grades and Grade Requirements.--(1) Subsection<br/>(b) of section 7404 is amended (A) by striking ``(1)'' after ``(b)'';<br/> (B) in the Physician and Dentist Schedule, by striking the<br/> items relating to the grades and inserting the following:<br/> ``Physician grade.<br/> ``Dentist grade.''; and<br/> (C) by striking paragraph (2).<br/><br/> (2) Subsection (a) of such section is amended by adding at the end<br/>the following: ``The pay of physicians and dentists serving in positions<br/>to which an Executive order applies under the preceding sentence shall<br/>be determined under subchapter III of this chapter instead of such<br/>Executive order.''.<br/> (b) Simplification and Improvement of Pay Authorities.--Subchapter<br/>III of chapter 74 is amended to read as follows:<br/><br/> ``SUBCHAPTER III--PAY FOR PHYSICIANS AND DENTISTS<br/><br/>``Sec. 7431. Pay<br/><br/> ``(a) Elements of Pay.--Pay of physicians and dentists in the<br/>Veterans Health Administration shall consist of three elements as<br/>follows:<br/> ``(1) Base pay as provided for under subsection (b).<br/> ``(2) Market pay as provided for under subsection (c).<br/> ``(3) Performance pay as provided under subsection (d).<br/><br/>[[Page 2637]]<br/>118 STAT. 2637<br/><br/> ``(b) Base Pay.--One element of pay for physicians and dentists<br/>shall be base pay. Base pay shall meet the following requirements:<br/> ``(1) Each physician and dentist is entitled to base pay<br/> determined under the Physician and Dentist Base and Longevity<br/> Pay Schedule.<br/> ``(2) The Physician and Dentist Base and Longevity Pay<br/> Schedule is composed of 15 rates of base pay designated, from<br/> the lowest rate of pay to the highest rate of pay, as base pay<br/> steps 1 through 15.<br/> ``(3) The rate of base pay payable to a physician or dentist<br/> is based on the total number of the years of the service of the<br/> physician or dentist in the Veterans Health Administration as<br/> follows:<br/><br/>``For a physician or dentist The rate of base pay is...................<br/> with total service of: the rate payable for:.....................<br/>two years or less step 1<br/>more than 2 years and not more than 4 step 2<br/> years<br/>more than 4 years and not more than 6 step 3<br/> years<br/>more than 6 years and not more than 8 step 4<br/> years<br/>more than 8 years and not more than 10 step 5<br/> years<br/>more than 10 years and not more than 12 step 6<br/> years<br/>more than 12 years and not more than 14 step 7<br/> years<br/>more than 14 years and not more than 16 step 8<br/> years<br/>more than 16 years and not more than 18 step 9<br/> years<br/>more than 18 years and not more than 20 step 10<br/> years<br/>more than 20 years and not more than 22 step 11<br/> years<br/>more than 22 years and not more than 24 step 12<br/> years<br/>more than 24 years and not more than 26 step 13<br/> years<br/>more than 26 years and not more than 28 step 14<br/> years<br/>more than 28 years step 15.<br/><br/> ``(4) At the same time as rates of basic pay are increased<br/> for a year under section 5303 of title 5, the Secretary shall<br/> increase the amount of base pay payable under this subsection<br/> for that year by a percentage equal to the percentage by which<br/> rates of basic pay are increased under such section for that<br/> year.<br/><br/> ``(c) Market Pay.--One element of pay for physicians and dentists<br/>shall be market pay. Market pay shall meet the following requirements:<br/> ``(1) Each physician and dentist is eligible for market pay.<br/> ``(2) Market pay shall consist of pay intended to reflect<br/> the recruitment and retention needs for the specialty or<br/> assignment (as defined by the Secretary) of a particular<br/> physician or dentist in a facility of the Department of Veterans<br/> Affairs.<br/> ``(3) The annual amount of the market pay payable to a<br/> physician or dentist shall be determined by the Secretary on a<br/> case-by-case basis.<br/> ``(4)(A) In determining the amount of market pay for<br/> physicians or dentists, the Secretary shall consult two or more<br/> national surveys of pay for physicians or dentists, as<br/> applicable, whether prepared by private, public, or quasi-public<br/> entities in order to make a general assessment of the range of<br/> pays payable to physicians or dentists, as applicable.<br/> ``(B)(i) In determining the amount of the market pay for a<br/> particular physician or dentist under this subsection, and in<br/> determining a tier (if any) to apply to a physician or dentist<br/> under subsection (e)(1)(B), the Secretary shall consult with<br/><br/>[[Page 2638]]<br/>118 STAT. 2638<br/><br/> and consider the recommendations of an appropriate panel or<br/> board composed of physicians or dentists (as applicable).<br/> ``(ii) A physician or dentist may not be a member of the<br/> panel or board that makes recommendations under clause (i) with<br/> respect to the market pay of such physician or dentist, as the<br/> case may be.<br/> ``(iii) The Secretary should, to the extent practicable,<br/> ensure that a panel or board consulted under this subparagraph<br/> includes physicians or dentists (as applicable) who are<br/> practicing clinicians and who do not hold management positions<br/> in the medical facility of the Department at which the physician<br/> or dentist subject to the consultation is employed.<br/> ``(5) The determination of the amount of market pay of a<br/> physician or dentist shall take into account ``(A) the level of experience of the physician or<br/> dentist in the specialty or assignment of the physician<br/> or dentist;<br/> ``(B) the need for the specialty or assignment of<br/> the physician or dentist at the medical facility of the<br/> Department concerned;<br/> ``(C) the health care labor market for the specialty<br/> or assignment of the physician or dentist, which may<br/> cover any geographic area the Secretary considers<br/> appropriate for the specialty or assignment;<br/> ``(D) the board certifications, if any, of the<br/> physician or dentist;<br/> ``(E) the prior experience, if any, of the physician<br/> or dentist as an employee of the Veterans Health<br/> Administration; and<br/> ``(F) such other considerations as the Secretary<br/> considers appropriate.<br/> ``(6) The amount of market pay of a physician or dentist<br/> shall be evaluated by the Secretary not less often than once<br/> every 24 months. The amount of market pay may be adjusted as the<br/> result of an evaluation under this<br/> paragraph. NOTE: Notice. A physician or dentist whose market<br/> pay is evaluated under this paragraph shall receive written<br/> notice of the results of such evaluation in accordance with<br/> procedures prescribed under section 7433 of this title.<br/> ``(7) No adjustment of the amount of market pay of a<br/> physician or dentist under paragraph (6) may result in a<br/> reduction of the amount of market pay of the physician or<br/> dentist while in the same position or assignment at the medical<br/> facility of the Department concerned.<br/><br/> ``(d) Performance Pay.--(1) One element of pay for physicians and<br/>dentists shall be performance pay.<br/> ``(2) Performance pay shall be paid to a physician or dentist on the<br/>basis of the physician's or dentist's achievement of specific goals and<br/>performance objectives prescribed by the Secretary.<br/> ``(3) The Secretary shall ensure that each physician and dentist of<br/>the Department is advised of the specific goals or objectives that are<br/>to be measured by the Secretary in determining the eligibility of that<br/>physician or dentist for performance pay.<br/> ``(4) The amount of the performance pay payable to a physician or<br/>dentist may vary annually on the basis of individual achievement or<br/>attainment of the goals or objectives applicable to the physician or<br/>dentist under paragraph (2).<br/><br/>[[Page 2639]]<br/>118 STAT. 2639<br/><br/> ``(5) The amount of performance pay payable to a physician or<br/>dentist in a fiscal year shall be determined in accordance with<br/>regulations prescribed by the Secretary, but may not exceed the lower<br/>of ``(A) $15,000; or<br/> ``(B) the amount equal to 7.5 percent of the sum of the base<br/> pay and the market pay payable to such physician or dentist in<br/> that fiscal year.<br/><br/> ``(6) A failure to meet goals or objectives applicable to a<br/>physician or dentist under paragraph (2) may not be the sole basis for<br/>an adverse personnel action against that physician or dentist.<br/> ``(e) Requirements and Limitations on Total Pay.--(1)(A) Not less<br/>often than once every two years, the Secretary shall prescribe for<br/>Department-wide applicability the minimum and maximum amounts of annual<br/>pay that may be paid under this section to physicians and the minimum<br/>and maximum amounts of annual pay that may be paid under this section to<br/>dentists.<br/> ``(B) The Secretary may prescribe for Department-wide applicability<br/>under this paragraph separate minimum and maximum amounts of pay for a<br/>specialty or assignment. If the Secretary prescribes separate minimum<br/>and maximum amounts for a specialty or assignment, the Secretary may<br/>establish up to four tiers of minimum and maximum amounts for such<br/>specialty or assignment and prescribe for each tier a minimum amount and<br/>a maximum amount that the Secretary determines appropriate for the<br/>professional responsibilities, professional achievements, and<br/>administrative duties of the physicians or dentists (as the case may be)<br/>whose pay is set within that tier.<br/> ``(C) NOTE: Federal Register, publication. Effective<br/>date. Amounts prescribed under this paragraph shall be published in<br/>the Federal Register, and shall not take effect until at least 60 days<br/>after the date of publication.<br/><br/> ``(2) Except as provided in paragraph (3) and subject to paragraph<br/>(4), the sum of the total amount of the annual rate of base pay payable<br/>to a physician or dentist under subsection (b) and the market pay<br/>determined for the physician or dentist under subsection (c) may not be<br/>less than the minimum amount, nor more than the maximum amount,<br/>applicable to specialty or assignment of the physician or dentist under<br/>paragraph (1).<br/> ``(3) The sum of the total amount of the annual rate of base pay<br/>payable to a physician or dentist under subsection (b) and the market<br/>pay determined for the physician or dentist under subsection (c) may<br/>exceed the maximum amount applicable to the specialty or assignment of<br/>the physician or dentist under paragraph (1) as a result of an<br/>adjustment under paragraph (3) or (4) of subsection (b).<br/> ``(4) In no case may the total amount of compensation paid to a<br/>physician or dentist under this title in any year exceed the amount of<br/>annual compensation (excluding expenses) specified in section 102 of<br/>title 3.<br/> ``(f) Treatment of Pay.--Pay under subsections (b) and (c) of this<br/>section shall be considered pay for all purposes, including retirement<br/>benefits under chapters 83 and 84 of title 5 and other benefits.<br/> ``(g) Ancillary Effects of Decreases in Pay.--(1) A decrease in pay<br/>of a physician or dentist resulting from an adjustment in the amount of<br/>market pay of the physician or dentist under subsection (c) shall not be<br/>treated as an adverse action.<br/><br/>[[Page 2640]]<br/>118 STAT. 2640<br/><br/> ``(2) If the pay of a physician or dentist is reduced under this<br/>subchapter as a result of an involuntary reassignment in connection with<br/>a disciplinary action taken against the physician or dentist, the<br/>involuntary reassignment shall be subject to appeal under subchapter V<br/>of this chapter.<br/> ``(h) Delegation of Responsibilities.--The Secretary may delegate to<br/>an appropriate officer or employee of the Department any responsibility<br/>of the Secretary under subsection (c), (d), or (e) except for the<br/>responsibilities of the Secretary under subsection (e)(1).<br/><br/>``Sec. 7432. Pay of Under Secretary for Health<br/><br/> ``(a) Base Pay.--The base pay of the Under Secretary for Health<br/>shall be the annual rate of basic pay for positions at Level III of the<br/>Executive Schedule under section 5314 of title 5.<br/> ``(b) Market Pay.--(1) In the case of an Under Secretary for Health<br/>who is also a physician or dentist, in addition to the base pay<br/>specified in subsection (a) the Under Secretary for Health may also be<br/>paid the market pay element of pay of physicians and dentists under<br/>section 7431(c) of this title.<br/> ``(2) The amount of market pay of the Under Secretary for Health<br/>under this subsection shall be established by the Secretary.<br/> ``(3) In establishing the amount of market pay of the Under<br/>Secretary for Health under this subsection, the Secretary shall utilize<br/>an appropriate health care labor market selected by the Secretary for<br/>purposes of this subsection.<br/> ``(c) Treatment of Pay.--Pay under this section shall be considered<br/>pay for all purposes, including retirement benefits under chapters 83<br/>and 84 of title 5 and other benefits.<br/><br/>``Sec. 7433. Administrative matters<br/><br/> ``(a) Regulations.--(1) The Secretary shall prescribe regulations<br/>relating to the pay of physicians and dentists in the Veterans Health<br/>Administration under this subchapter.<br/> ``(2) In prescribing the regulations, the Secretary shall take into<br/>account the recommendations of the Under Secretary for Health on the<br/>administration of this subchapter. In formulating recommendations for<br/>the purpose of this paragraph, the Under Secretary shall request the<br/>views of representatives of labor organizations that are exclusive<br/>representatives of physicians and dentists of the Department and the<br/>views of representatives of professional organizations of physicians and<br/>dentists of the Department.<br/> ``(b) Reports.--(1) Not later than 18 months after the Secretary<br/>prescribes the regulations required by subsection (a), and annually<br/>thereafter for the next 5 years, the Secretary shall submit to the<br/>Committees on Veterans' Affairs of the Senate and House of<br/>Representatives a report on the pay of physicians and dentists in the<br/>Veterans Health Administration under this subchapter.<br/> ``(2) Each report under this subsection shall include the following:<br/> ``(A) A description of the rates of pay in effect during the<br/> current fiscal year with a comparison to the rates in effect<br/> during the fiscal year preceding the current fiscal year, set<br/> forth by facility and by specialty.<br/> ``(B) The number of physicians and dentists who left the<br/> Veterans Health Administration during the preceding fiscal year.<br/><br/>[[Page 2641]]<br/>118 STAT. 2641<br/><br/> ``(C) The number of unfilled physician positions and dentist<br/> positions in each specialty in the Veterans Health<br/> Administration, the average and maximum lengths of time that<br/> such positions have been unfilled, and an assessment of the<br/> reasons that such positions remain unfilled.<br/> ``(D) An assessment of the impact of implementation of this<br/> subchapter on efforts to recruit and retain physicians and<br/> dentists in the Veterans Health Administration.<br/><br/> ``(3) The first two annual reports under this subsection shall also<br/>include a comparison of staffing levels, contract expenditures, and<br/>average salaries of physicians and dentists in the Veterans Health<br/>Administration for the current fiscal year and for the fiscal year<br/>preceding the current fiscal year, set forth by facility and by<br/>specialty.''.<br/> (c) NOTE: 38 USC 7431 note. Initial Rates of Base Pay for<br/>Physicians and Dentists.--The initial rates of base pay established for<br/>the base pay steps under the Physician and Dentist Base and Longevity<br/>Pay Schedule provided in section 7431(b) of title 38, United States Code<br/>(as added by subsection (b)), are as follows:<br/><br/>Base Pay Step: Rate of Pay:..............................<br/>1 $90,000<br/>2 $93,000<br/>3 $96,000<br/>4 $99,000<br/>5 $102,000<br/>6 $105,000<br/>7 $108,000<br/>8 $111,000<br/>9 $114,000<br/>10 $117,000<br/>11 $120,000<br/>12 $123,000<br/>13 $126,000<br/>14 $129,000<br/>15 $132,000.<br/><br/> (d) NOTE: 38 USC 7431 note. Effective Date.--(1) Notwithstanding<br/>the 60-day waiting requirement in section 7431(e)(1)(C) of title 38,<br/>United States Code (as amended by subsection (b)), pay provided for a<br/>physician or dentist under subchapter III of chapter 74 of such title,<br/>as amended by subsection (b), shall take effect on the first day of the<br/>first pay period applicable to such physician or dentist that begins on<br/>or after January 1, 2006.<br/><br/> (2) Pay provided for the Under Secretary for Health under subchapter<br/>III of chapter 74 of title 38, United States Code, as amended by this<br/>section shall take effect on the first day of the first pay period<br/>applicable to the Under Secretary that begins on or after January 1,<br/>2006.<br/> (e) Transition Provisions.-- NOTE: 38 USC 7431 note.<br/> (1) Physicians and dentists. (A) Pay.--(i) The amount of the pay payable on and<br/> after the date of the enactment of this Act to a<br/> physician or dentist in receipt of pay under section<br/> 7404 or 7405 of title 38, United States Code, as of the<br/> day before such date shall continue to be determined<br/> under such section (as in effect on the day before such<br/> date) until the effective date that is applicable under<br/> subsection (d) to such physician or dentist, as the case<br/> may be.<br/> (ii) A physician or dentist appointed or reassigned<br/> on or after the date of the enactment of this Act, but<br/> before<br/><br/>[[Page 2642]]<br/>118 STAT. 2642<br/><br/> the effective date applicable under subsection (d) to<br/> such physician or dentist, shall be compensated in<br/> accordance with applicable provisions of section 7404 or<br/> 7405 of title 38, United States Code (as in effect on<br/> the day before date of the enactment of this Act), until<br/> such effective date.<br/> (B) Special pay.--(i) A special pay agreement<br/> entered into by a physician or dentist under subchapter<br/> III of chapter 74 of title 38, United States Code,<br/> before the date of the enactment of this Act shall<br/> terminate on the date of the enactment of this Act.<br/> However, a physician or dentist in receipt of special<br/> pay pursuant to such an agreement on that date shall<br/> continue to receive special pay under the terms of such<br/> agreement until the effective date that is applicable<br/> under subsection (d) to such physician or dentist.<br/> (ii) A physician or dentist described in<br/> subparagraph (A)(ii) may be paid special pay under<br/> applicable provisions of section 7433, 7434, 7435, or<br/> 7436 of title 38, United States Code (as in effect on<br/> the day before the date of the enactment of this Act),<br/> during the period beginning on the date of the<br/> appointment or reassignment of such physician or<br/> dentist, as the case may be, and ending on the effective<br/> date applicable under subsection (d) to such physician<br/> or dentist. However, no special pay agreement shall be<br/> required for the payment of special pay under this<br/> clause.<br/> (C) Treatment of special pay.--(i) Special pay paid<br/> under subparagraph (B) to a physician or dentist during<br/> the period beginning on the date of the enactment of<br/> this Act and ending on the effective date applicable<br/> under subsection (d) to such physician or dentist shall<br/> be subject to the provisions of paragraphs (1), (2),<br/> (4), (5), and (6) of section 7438(b) of title 38, United<br/> States Code (as in effect on the day before the date of<br/> the enactment of this Act).<br/> (ii) Special pay paid to a physician or dentist<br/> under section 7438 of title 38, United States Code (as<br/> in effect on the day before the date of the enactment of<br/> this Act), shall be fully creditable for purposes of<br/> computing benefits under chapters 83 and 84 of title 5,<br/> United States Code.<br/> (D) Preservation of pay.--The amount of pay paid to<br/> a physician or dentist after the effective date of this<br/> Act shall not be less than the amount of pay paid to<br/> such physician or dentist on the day before the<br/> effective date of this Act while such physician or<br/> dentist remains in the same position or assignment.<br/> (2) Under secretary for health. (A) Special pay.--(i) The current special pay<br/> agreement entered into by the Under Secretary for Health<br/> under subchapters I and III of chapter 74 of title 38,<br/> United States Code, before the date of the enactment of<br/> this Act shall terminate on the date of the enactment of<br/> this Act. However, the Under Secretary shall continue to<br/> receive special pay under the terms of such agreement<br/> until the effective date that is applicable under<br/> subsection (d) to the Under Secretary.<br/><br/>[[Page 2643]]<br/>118 STAT. 2643<br/><br/> (ii) An individual appointed as Under Secretary for<br/> Health on or after the date of the enactment of this Act<br/> and before the effective date applicable under<br/> subsection (d) to the Under Secretary shall be paid<br/> special pay in accordance with the provisions of<br/> sections 7432(d)(2) and 7433 of title 38, United States<br/> Code (as in effect on the day before the date of the<br/> enactment of this Act), during the period beginning on<br/> the date of appointment and ending on such effective<br/> date. However, no special pay agreement shall be<br/> required for the payment of special pay under this<br/> clause.<br/> (B) Treatment of special pay.--Special pay paid<br/> under subparagraph (A) during the period beginning on<br/> the date of the enactment of this Act and ending on the<br/> effective date applicable under subsection (d) to the<br/> Under Secretary (i) shall be subject to the provisions of<br/> paragraphs (1), (2), (4), (5), and (6) of section<br/> 7438(b) of title 38, United States Code (as in<br/> effect on the day before the date of the enactment<br/> of this Act); and<br/> (ii) shall be fully creditable for purposes of<br/> computing benefits under chapters 83 and 84 of<br/> title 5, United States Code.<br/><br/> (f) Conforming Amendments.--Section 7404 is amended (1) in subsection (c), by striking ``special pay'' and<br/> inserting ``pay''; and<br/> (2) in subsection (d), by striking ``pay may not be paid''<br/> and all that follows and inserting ``pay for positions for which<br/> basic pay is paid under this section may not be paid at a rate<br/> in excess of the rate of basic pay authorized by section 5316 of<br/> title 5 for positions in Level V of the Executive Schedule.''.<br/><br/> (g) Clerical Amendment.--The table of sections at the beginning of<br/>chapter 74 is amended by striking the items relating to subchapter III<br/>and inserting the following new items:<br/> ``SUBCHAPTER III--PAY FOR PHYSICIANS AND DENTISTS<br/>``Sec. 7431. Pay.<br/>``Sec. 7432. Pay of Under Secretary for Health.<br/>``Sec. 7433. Administrative matters.''.<br/><br/>SEC. 4. ALTERNATE WORK SCHEDULES FOR REGISTERED NURSES.<br/><br/> (a) In General.--(1) Chapter 74 is amended by inserting after<br/>section 7456 the following new section:<br/><br/>``Sec. 7456A. Nurses: alternate work schedules<br/><br/> ``(a) Applicability.--This section applies to registered nurses<br/>appointed under this chapter.<br/> ``(b) 36/40 Work Schedule.--(1)(A) Subject to paragraph (2), if the<br/>Secretary determines it to be necessary in order to obtain or retain the<br/>services of registered nurses at any Department health-care facility,<br/>the Secretary may provide, in the case of nurses employed at such<br/>facility, that such nurses who work three regularly scheduled 12-hour<br/>tours of duty within a work week shall be considered for all purposes to<br/>have worked a full 40-hour basic work week.<br/> ``(B) A nurse who works under the authority in subparagraph (A)<br/>shall be considered a 0.90 full-time equivalent employee in<br/><br/>[[Page 2644]]<br/>118 STAT. 2644<br/><br/>computing full-time equivalent employees for the purposes of determining<br/>compliance with personnel ceilings.<br/> ``(2)(A) Basic and additional pay for a nurse who is considered<br/>under paragraph (1) to have worked a full 40-hour basic work week shall<br/>be subject to subparagraphs (B) and (C).<br/> ``(B) The hourly rate of basic pay for a nurse covered by this<br/>paragraph for service performed as part of a regularly scheduled 36-hour<br/>tour of duty within the work week shall be derived by dividing the<br/>nurse's annual rate of basic pay by 1,872.<br/> ``(C) NOTE: Overtime pay. The Secretary shall pay overtime pay<br/>to a nurse covered by this paragraph who ``(i) performs a period of service in excess of such nurse's<br/> regularly scheduled 36-hour tour of duty within an<br/> administrative work week;<br/> ``(ii) for officially ordered or approved service, performs<br/> a period of service in excess of 8 hours on a day other than a<br/> day on which such nurse's regularly scheduled 12-hour tour of<br/> duty falls;<br/> ``(iii) performs a period of service in excess of 12 hours<br/> for any day included in the regularly scheduled 36-hour tour of<br/> duty work week; or<br/> ``(iv) performs a period of service in excess of 40 hours<br/> during an administrative work week.<br/><br/> ``(D) The Secretary may provide a nurse to whom this subsection<br/>applies with additional pay under section 7453 of this title for any<br/>period included in a regularly scheduled 12-hour tour of duty.<br/> ``(3) A nurse who works a work schedule described in this subsection<br/>who is absent on approved sick leave or annual leave during a regularly<br/>scheduled 12-hour tour of duty shall be charged for such leave at a rate<br/>of ten hours of leave for every nine hours of absence.<br/> ``(c) Holiday Pay.--A nurse working a work schedule under subsection<br/>(b) that includes a holiday designated by law or Executive order shall<br/>be eligible for holiday pay under section 7453(d) of this title for any<br/>service performed by the nurse on such holiday under such section.<br/> ``(d) 9-Month Work Schedule for Certain Nurses.--(1) The Secretary<br/>may authorize a registered nurse appointed under section 7405 of this<br/>title, with the nurse's written consent, to work full time for nine<br/>months with 3 months off duty, within a fiscal year, and be paid at 75<br/>percent of the full-time rate for such nurse's grade for each pay period<br/>of such fiscal year.<br/> ``(2) A nurse who works under the authority in paragraph (1) shall<br/>be considered a 0.75 full-time equivalent employee in computing fulltime equivalent employees for the purposes of determining compliance<br/>with personnel ceilings.<br/> ``(3) Work under this subsection shall be considered part-time<br/>service for purposes of computing benefits under chapters 83 and 84 of<br/>title 5.<br/> ``(4) A nurse who works under the authority in paragraph (1) shall<br/>be considered a full-time employee for purposes of chapter 89 of title<br/>5.<br/> ``(e) Notification of Modification of Benefits.--The Secretary shall<br/>provide each employee with respect to whom an alternate work schedule<br/>under this section may apply written notice of the effect, if any, that<br/>the alternate work schedule will have on the employee's health care<br/>premium, retirement, life insurance<br/><br/>[[Page 2645]]<br/>118 STAT. 2645<br/><br/>premium, probationary status, or other benefit or condition of<br/>employment. NOTE: Deadline. The notice shall be provided not later<br/>than 14 days before the employee consents to the alternate work<br/>schedule.<br/><br/> ``(f) Regulations.--The Secretary shall prescribe regulations to<br/>carry out this section.''.<br/> (2) The table of sections at the beginning of chapter 74 is amended<br/>by inserting after the item relating to section 7456 the following new<br/>item:<br/><br/>``Sec. 7456A. Nurses: alternate work schedules.''.<br/><br/> (b) Policy Against Certain Work Hours.--(1) It is the sense of<br/>Congress to encourage the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to prevent work<br/>hours by nurses providing direct patient care in excess of 12<br/>consecutive hours or in excess of 60 hours in any 7-day period, except<br/>in the case of nurses providing emergency care.<br/> (2) NOTE: Deadline. Certification. Not later than one year after<br/>the date of the enactment of this Act and every year thereafter for the<br/>next two years, the Secretary shall certify to Congress whether or not<br/>each Veterans Health Administration facility has in place, as of the<br/>date of such certification, a policy designed to prevent work hours by<br/>nurses providing direct patient care (other than nurses providing<br/>emergency care) in excess of 12 consecutive hours or in excess of 60<br/>hours in any 7-day period.<br/><br/>SEC. 5. NURSE EXECUTIVE SPECIAL PAY.<br/><br/> Section 7452 is amended by adding at the end the following new<br/>subsection:<br/> ``(g)(1) In order to recruit and retain highly qualified Department<br/>nurse executives, the Secretary may, in accordance with regulations<br/>prescribed by the Secretary, pay special pay to the nurse executive at<br/>each location as follows:<br/> ``(A) Each Department health care facility.<br/> ``(B) The Central Office.<br/><br/> ``(2) The amount of special pay paid to a nurse executive under<br/>paragraph (1) shall be not less than $10,000 or more than $25,000.<br/> ``(3) The amount of special pay paid to a nurse executive under<br/>paragraph (1) shall be based on factors such as the grade of the nurse<br/>executive position, the scope and complexity of the nurse executive<br/>position, the personal qualifications of the nurse executive, the<br/>characteristics of the health care facility concerned, the nature and<br/>number of specialty care units at the health care facility concerned,<br/>demonstrated difficulties in recruitment and retention of nurse<br/>executives at the health care facility concerned, and such other factors<br/>as the Secretary considers appropriate.<br/> ``(4) Special pay paid to a nurse executive under paragraph (1)<br/>shall be in addition to any other pay (including basic pay) and<br/>allowances to which the nurse executive is entitled, and shall be<br/>considered pay for all purposes, including retirement benefits under<br/>chapters 83 and 84 of title 5, and other benefits, but shall<br/><br/>[[Page 2646]]<br/>118 STAT. 2646<br/><br/>not be considered basic pay for purposes of adverse actions under<br/>subchapter V of this chapter.''.<br/><br/> Approved December 3, 2004.<br/><br/>LEGISLATIVE HISTORY--S. 2484:<br/><br/>SENATE REPORTS: No. 108-357 (Comm. on Veterans' Affairs).<br/>CONGRESSIONAL RECORD, Vol. 150 (2004):<br/> Oct. 5, considered and passed Senate.<br/> Nov. 17, considered and passed House.<br/>
